business.headline: Many jobs are immune to AI disruptions. Economic Survey lists themEven as Artificial Intelligence reshapes workplaces worldwide, the Economic Survey 2025-26 points to jobs that could be immune to AI disruptions. The survey has identified the kinds of jobs that technology is least likely to replace and explains why soft skills and hands-on expertise matter in an AI-driven economy.

From startups to scale-ups: What women entrepreneurs want from Budget 2026For many women entrepreneurs, the ask from Budget 2026 is clear: help them grow bigger. After years of startup-focused policies, they now want support that enables scale, competitiveness and long-term sustainability.

Sensex, Nifty close higher as Economic Survey lifts market mood ahead of BudgetThe Nifty 50 closed 0.3% higher at 25,418.90, while the BSE Sensex rose 0.27% to end at 82,566.37. Both indices recovered after falling around 0.8% earlier in the day, as buying returned in heavyweight stocks.

From inflation, AI to mental health: 6 key takeaways from CEA's Economic Survey briefingIndia's economic outlook is improving on several fronts, but fresh risks are also coming into focus. Speaking at the Economic Survey briefing, the CEA highlighted six key trends shaping growth, jobs, technology and mental well-being.

RTI reveals NITI Aayog has no research on long-term impact of 'Freebies'According to its annual reports, the think tank has completed 34 studies since 2022 and approved 32 new research studies during the same period, yet none relate to the fiscal sustainability or long-term economic consequences of state freebie schemes.

8th Pay Commission: Can employees expect a bigger pay hike this time?The 8th Pay Commission has raised hopes of a higher salary hike for central government employees and pensioners. With consumption slowing and incomes under pressure, expectations this time are higher than in the past.

Rupee sinks to lifetime low of Rs 92: Why is it falling again?The rupee's record low comes amid heavy foreign outflows, weak global cues, limited RBI intervention and delayed exporter inflows, leaving the currency stuck unless policy action or fresh foreign buying emerges.

Budget 2026: Jewellery industry pushes for GST cuts, duty relief and simpler rulesAs Budget 2026 approaches, India's jewellery industry is calling for lower taxes and simpler rules to boost demand, support jobs and bring more buyers back to the market.
Economic Survey 2026 pegs FY27 growth to be 6.8%–7.2%, higher than last yearIndia's economy expected to grow at 6.8%-7.2%, higher than last year's outlook: Economic Survey 2026

India–EU FTA: Why is the 'Mother of All Deals' India's global moment?At a time when protectionism and economic nationalism are resurging globally, the India–EU FTA demonstrates that large economies can still choose cooperation over confrontation. It reflects confidence in India's macroeconomic stability, regulatory predictability, and reform trajectory.

Indonesia's richest man loses nearly $9 billion in a day. Here's whyThe biggest loss was suffered by Prajogo Pangestu, Indonesia's richest person. His net worth fell by around $9 billion after shares of his energy and mining companies dropped sharply.

Gold crosses Rs 1.8 lakh, silver above Rs 4 lakh: 4 key reasons for the surgeThe unstoppable gold and silver rally has been fuelled by global uncertainty, strong demand and powerful technical momentum that have kept precious metals on an unbroken upward run.

Economic Survey 2026: What to expect and why it's importantThis year's Economic Survey comes at a time when the global environment remains unpredictable. Geopolitical tensions, volatile commodity prices, fluctuating interest rate expectations, and uneven global growth continue to influence economic outcomes for emerging markets.

Silver crosses Rs 4 lakh per kg: Here's what buyers should knowA major reason behind the spike is growing concern about a silver shortage. Global inventories have been tightening because demand from industries has grown faster than supply. Silver is used in solar panels, electric vehicles, electronics and high-tech manufacturing.

Sensex tumbles 500 points: 4 reasons why stock market is falling todayAt 10:10 am, the Sensex was down 560 points, or 0.68%, at 81,784.28, and the Nifty fell 158 points to 25,184.30, slipping below key intraday support.

Economic Survey pointers: CEA flags skill gaps and structural risks in AI eraEconomic Survey Live Updates: The Economic Survey is an annual review of India's economy, looking at how the economy performed over the past year. It is prepared by the Department of Economic Affairs under the guidance of the Chief Economic Adviser and published by the Ministry of Finance.

Rupee slips to an all-time low of Rs 92 against dollar, declined 2% this yearThe rupee fell to 91.9850 against the dollar, crossing its previous all-time low of 91.9650 touched last week. This marked the first time the currency has moved so close to the 92 level.
Sensex, Nifty open lower ahead of Budget, rupee falls to all-time lowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 275 points to 82,069.68, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 48 points to 25,294.75 as of 9:25 am.

US Fed holds key interest rates: Will Dalal Street cheer or stay cautious?The US Federal Reserve held key interest rates steady and Dalal Street is expected to react to it. Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,371 around 8:30 AM. This indicates an opening close to Wednesday's Nifty 50 closing level of 25,342.75.

Saudi Arabia turns to wealthy families in fresh push to raise new funds: ReportSaudi Arabia's sovereign wealth fund, the Public Investment Fund, held a meeting last month with around a dozen of the kingdom's most prominent families on the Red Sea coast.

entertainment.headline: K-soap stars Park Seo Joon, Jung Yu Mi and Choi Woo Shik in new show Park Seo Joon, Jung Yu Mi and Choi Woo Shik are confirmed to appear in producing director Na Young Suk's new variety show, expected to air on tvN in the first half of this year. Filming is set to begin in February within South Korea, with further details about the show's concept and schedule yet to be announced.

Dhanush's upcoming D55 update: Sai Abhyankkar to compose music for film Sai Abhyankkar has been confirmed as the music composer for D55, the upcoming film featuring Dhanush and directed by Rajkumar Periyasamy.

Pulkit Samrat calls his boxer role in Glory intense yet addictive Pulkit Samrat said playing a boxer in Netflix's Glory was an "intense, yet addictive" experience as he makes his OTT debut as a lead actor.

Amid Border 2 success, Sunny Deol shares heartfelt thank you in video from hills Sunny Deol shared a warm video from the hills, thanking fans for the love shown to Border 2. The war drama earlier crossed Rs 200 crore at the box office in just six days.

Suniel Shetty explains why he won't watch son Ahan in Border 2 yet Suniel Shetty has expressed pride in his son Ahan Shetty's role in Border 2, choosing to wait until the film reaches a global Rs 500 crore collection before watching it, while the film continues its strong box office run.

As Arijit Singh quits playback, Vishal Dadlani shares post about success and peace Vishal Dadlani shared a life lesson on Instagram, reminding fans that success, money, and power do not guarantee peace or contentment.

John Abraham's new look worries fans: Is he ill? Actor John Abraham's latest clean-shaven look has led to a flurry of reactions on social media, with fans expressing surprise and speculating about his new appearance.

Is Prabhas's Salaar 2 still on? Makers share hint amid shelving rumours The production team behind Prabhas's Salaar: Part 1 – Ceasefire addressed speculation over the sequel's status by posting a behind-the-scenes photo on social media, confirming that the second part has not been shelved.

Hot Spot 2 Much director on controversial scene: Criticise film, not my expression Director Vignesh Karthick addressed social media backlash over controversial scenes depicting mansplaining scenes in Hotspot 2 Much, defending his creative choices and commenting on the responsibilities of filmmakers.

Varun Dhawan suffered tailbone fracture during Border 2 battle scene, shares ordeal Varun Dhawan reveals he suffered a tailbone fracture while shooting an intense battle sequence for Border 2. The actor says the injury, though painful, made his journey on the film unforgettable.

Aditi Rao Hydari calls Gandhi Talks a film where emotions speak without words Aditi Rao Hydari highlighted the emotional power of silence in Gandhi Talks, calling it a film where feelings speak louder than words.

This actor studied with Smriti Irani, now plays her son in 'Kyunki Saas Bhi...' Smriti Irani revealed a surprising school connection with one of her Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi co-stars. He plays his son on the show.

Mohanlal-Sreenivasan classic Udayananu Tharam gets 4K Dolby Atmos re-release The Malayalam film Udayananu Tharam, starring Mohanlal and scripted by the late Sreenivasan, is set for a 4K Dolby Atmos theatrical re-release on February 6.

Margot Robbie's Taj Mahal diamond one of the most historic jewels ever. Read why Margot Robbie showcased Elizabeth Taylor's legendary Taj Mahal diamond necklace at the Wuthering Heights premiere in Los Angeles. This historic jewellery piece links Hollywood glamour with Mughal dynasty heritage and timeless love stories.

Who is Chavundi Daiva and how did Ranveer Singh's Kantara stunt cross the line? Ranveer Singh faced backlash for mimicking the sacred Chavundi Daiva ritual at IFFI Goa. The incident sparked controversy over respect for Tulu Nadu's religious traditions.

Rakkasapuradol trailer: Raj B Shetty turns alcoholic cop in a whodunnit thriller Raj B Shetty's upcoming investigative thriller, Rakkasapuradol, is scheduled for a theatrical release on February 6. Directed by debutant Ravi Saranga, the trailer introduces Raj as an alcoholic cop on the trail of a mysterious murderer.

Prabhas gears up for back-to-back shoots of Kalki 2 and Spirit in 2026: Report Prabhas is set for a busy February 2026 as he takes on principal photography for Kalki 2 and resumes work on Spirit. The actor will be shooting for the two major projects simultaneously.

Bridgerton Season 4 review: Benedict's Cinderella romance with poetic payoffRelease Date:Thu Jan 29, 2026 Bridgerton Season 4 review: Bridgerton Season 4 centres on Benedict's emotionally rich Cinderella romance. The season balances chaos and calm while exploring complex relationships and societal bonds.

Margot adds gothic glam to Wuthering Heights style with feathers and shadows Margot Robbie embraces a gothic, literary fashion narrative for the Wuthering Heights press tour, wearing feathered Victoria Beckham designs and custom jewellery inspired by Emily Bronte's novel.

general news.headline: Ajit Pawar plane crash: Black box in custody, Centre promises time-bound probeIn his reply to Devendra Fadnavis, Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu Kinjarapu assured the Maharashtra Chief Minister that his ministry has begun the probe and that it will be conducted in a transparent and time-bound manner.

NCP to propose Sunetra as Maharashtra Deputy CM, may contest Ajit Pawar's seatA leadership tussle has erupted in the NCP after Ajit Pawar's death, with senior leaders rallying around Sunetra Pawar as a potential successor, as per sources.

Shashi Tharoor meets Rahul Gandhi in Parliament amid rift buzz: On same pageShashi Tharoor met Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge in Parliament as rift rumours swirled. The Congress MP said that there was nothing unusual about meeting party leaders ahead of the new Parliament session.

Bihar hikes women's employment scheme allowance from Rs 10,000 to Rs 2 lakhThe Bihar government has significantly increased financial assistance under the Chief Minister's Women Employment Scheme to empower women entrepreneurs. This move aims to boost local employment and reduce migration by linking support to beneficiaries' performance.

Travesty of UGC Campus Rules 2026: They turn a protective shield into a deadly swordIn India's grievance-fueled politics, a shield for the vulnerable morphs into a sword against others. The 2026 UGC Regulations exemplify this betrayal, weaponising campuses for likely selective targeting.

Massive fire raging in Dzukou Valley for 3 days, spreading towards ManipurA massive fire has been raging in Nagaland's Dzukou Valley, a trekkers' favourite, for three days. Locals say that the fire is beyond control and suspect the role of miscreants, given its location. Trekkers have been evacuated, NDRF deployed, and IAF help was sought. The fire is fast spreading towards Manipur's Mount Esii.

What the EU leaders ate at Rashtrapati Bhavan: A Himalayan MenuPresident Droupadi Murmu hosted a grand dinner in honour of European Council President Antonio Costa and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen. Some traditional Yak cheese, mushroom, millets, and more from the Himalayan belt was served and how!

What a Pawar-less Mahayuti means for Fadnavis, ShindeAjit Pawar, who died in a plane crash on Wednesday, was a pragmatic politician who was capable of working with the Congress, Shiv Sena, and the BJP. The untimely death of Ajit 'Dada' comes as a setback to Devendra Fadnavis. Here is why.

Supriya Sule beat Sunetra in Lok Sabha polls. Now, she's bhabhi's pillar in tragedySupriya Sule took on the role of a protector, guarding Sunetra Pawar, during the funeral of her cousin Ajit dada. The sisters-in-law presented a picture of unity, portraying that, regardless of the difference in their political ideologies, they are a family first.
Economic survey flags dangerous digital addiction among India's youthThe report calls screen addiction among children and adolescents a growing public health risk.

Kashmiri shawl sellers beaten in Dehradun, claim they were abused over Pahalgam attackTwo Kashmiri shawl sellers allege assault by shopkeeper in Vikasnagar, Dehradun, sparking protests. The victims have alleged that they were attacked after the shopkeeper asked them their identity and then made objectionable remarks linking them with the Pahalgam terror attack.

It's court language, not mine: Defiant Himanta Sarma on 'trouble Miyas' remarkAssam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said both he and the BJP oppose the Miya Muslim community and urged people to put pressure on them, suggesting they should face difficulties that might push them to leave the state.

Is working from home just making you work more hours?Flexible work was meant to fix burnout, but mounting evidence suggests it may be quietly fuelling it instead. Harvard-backed research and Indian workplace realities reveal how flexibility without boundaries is stretching workdays and pushing professionals to the edge.

Many jobs are immune to AI disruptions. Economic Survey lists themEven as Artificial Intelligence reshapes workplaces worldwide, the Economic Survey 2025-26 points to jobs that could be immune to AI disruptions. The survey has identified the kinds of jobs that technology is least likely to replace and explains why soft skills and hands-on expertise matter in an AI-driven economy.
University of Bath School of Management announces up to £3 million in scholarships, empowering future global leadersStrategic Scholarship Investment Aimed at Attracting Exceptional Talent Worldwide

Roads to nowhere? Puzzling flyover designs expose flaws in India's infra planningIndia's rapid urban transport expansion faces scrutiny as several newly built flyovers and bridges reveal puzzling designs, raising commuter confusion and safety concerns. These viral infrastructure issues highlight the urgent need for better planning and coordination across states.

Injection, cryptic post, viral video: Mystery deepens in Rajasthan's Sadhvi deathNoted religious storyteller Sadhvi Prem Baisa died under mysterious circumstances in Rajasthan, prompting police to conduct a post-mortem and political leader Hanuman Beniwal has demanded a CBI probe.

A crisis in BJP-Sena alliance over BMC mayor post and the Bal Thackeray linkThere are cracks in Maharashtra's ruling Mahayuti alliance over the BMC Mayor's post. The Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena wants the post on a rotational basis, especially because this is Bal Thackeray's birth centenary year. An Uddhav Thackeray camp leader, using the same centenary occasion, urged Shinde to join forces with Shiv Sena (UBT).

Miami University: A Top U.S. Destination for Future Tech and Engineering LeadersMiami University Expands Opportunities for International Students Through Industry-Integrated Computer Science & Engineering Programs

Bridgerton Season 4 review: Benedict's Cinderella romance with poetic payoffRelease Date:Thu Jan 29, 2026Bridgerton Season 4 review: Bridgerton Season 4 centres on Benedict's emotionally rich Cinderella romance. The season balances chaos and calm while exploring complex relationships and societal bonds.

Pregnant Delhi Police commando beaten to death with dumbbell by husband over dowryThe victim, identified as Kajal, was reportedly regularly assaulted by her husband Ankur and his family over dowry demands and was four months pregnant at the time of her death.

Miranda House, DRDO develop Made-in-India chip that warns soldiers of heart attacksMiranda House developed a prototype BioFET sensor with DRDO to detect early cardiac risk. Professor Monika Tomar said the device can measure three biomarkers from a blood sample to give timely alerts.

Why BJP is facing the heat over UGC's caste equity rulesThe BJP, which receives solid support from upper caste groups, is facing pushback over the UGC's new equity norms to deal with caste-based discrimination in higher educational institutions. This is why the BJP is being faulted for the UGC's new norms. The Supreme Court on Thursday put the new rules on hold.

From inflation, AI to mental health: 6 key takeaways from CEA's Economic Survey briefingIndia's economic outlook is improving on several fronts, but fresh risks are also coming into focus. Speaking at the Economic Survey briefing, the CEA highlighted six key trends shaping growth, jobs, technology and mental well-being.

sports.headline: RCB vs UP Warriorz LIVE Score: UP fight to stay afloat RCB vs UP Warriorz LIVE Score, WPL 2026: The UP Warriorz will look to stay afloat when they take on Royal Challengers Bengaluru in a group encounter in the Women's Premier League 2026 at the Vadodara International Cricket Stadium on Thursday.

Rybakina beats Pegula in nervy semi final to set up revenge clash with Sabalenka Elena Rybakina advanced to the Australian Open 2026 final after a straight sets win over Jessica Pegula. She now faces world No 1 Aryna Sabalenka, aiming for revenge for her 2023 final defeat.

2036 Olympic bid: Why aquatics, rowing, cycling are key to India's medal plans As India works behind the scenes on its bid to host the 2036 Olympics, infrastructure is not a major worry, with Ahmedabad appearing largely ready for the challenge. What officials are focusing on instead is a rethink of India's medal strategy, particularly in sports like aquatics and cycling.

EFI sends rape-accused member as coach to Jordan, Sports Ministry issues notice EFI's decision to appoint rape-accused Tarsem Singh as coach for the upcoming Jordan qualifiers has triggered widespread outrage, further deepening the crisis surrounding the embattled federation. The Sports Ministry has now issued a show-cause notice to the Equestrian Federation of India (EFI).

Pakistan don't have the guts to boycott T20 World Cup 2026: Ajinkya Rahane Ajinkya Rahane has made a strong statement on Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2026 boycott theatrics. Despite off-field drama, Pakistan are set to participate with flights already booked to Sri Lanka.

After handshake snub, Sabalenka thumps Svitolina to move into Australian Open final Australian Open 2026: Aryna Sabalenka took a crushing straight-set win over Elina Svitloina to secure her fourth consecutive finals appearance at the Australian Open.

Elina Svitolina skips handshake, pre-match photo vs Aryna Sabalenka at Aus Open semis Elina Svitolina skipped the handshake and pre-match photo before her Australian Open semi-final against Aryna Sabalenka. The decision followed a familiar pattern shaped by politics, tension and recent history between the two players.

Sinhalese Sports Club in Sri Lanka gets floodlights ahead of T20 World Cup The Sinhalese Sports Club (SSC) has undergone a major upgrade ahead of the T20 World Cup, with the installation of floodlights marking a significant milestone in the club's 75-year history and making it the fifth international venue in Sri Lanka equipped to host day-night cricket.

Yuvraj drops bombshell on why he retired from cricket: Didn't feel respected Former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh has opened up about the reasons behind his decision to retire from cricket in June 2019. The former left-hander stepped away from international cricket and the Indian Premier League after being left out of India's squad for the ODI World Cup that year.

Watch: India's new T20 World Cup promo trolls greatest rivalry vs Pakistan India's new T20 World Cup promo takes a cheeky swipe at Pakistan ahead of their February 15 clash. The Star Sports video plays up recent dominance as the rivalry heads to Colombo.

Ashwin hits back at social media troll over indirect attack claim: Spoke to ViratFormer India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin responded to a social media troll who accused him of indirectly targeting Virat Kohli during his analysis of India's third T20I win over New Zealand in Guwahati.

Semi-final live: Rybakina wins tie-break thriller, to meet Sabalenka in finalAustralian Open Live, Women's Singles semi-final: Elena Rybakina is in firm control after taking the first set against Jessica Pegula in the women's singles semi-final at the Rod Laver Arena. Aryna Sabalenka races into the Australian Open final. She wins 6-2, 6-3 against 12th seed Elina Svitolina.

Cricket nomads: Meet the jersey sellers who travel India match by matchBehind the billion-dollar world of official kits, a nomadic tribe of sellers follows the cricket calendar by rail. Travelling from Bihar, Mumbai and Kolkata to the rest of the country, these daily-wage labourers clothe the masses, navigating thin margins and brand crackdowns to keep the stadium blue.

ICC suspends USA batter on corruption charges right ahead of T20 World CupUSA batter and former captain Aaron Jones has been suspended after facing match-fixing charges. The ICC says the case is part of a wider investigation, putting Jones' T20 World Cup future in doubt.USA cricket's World Cup preparations.

Rohit Sharma points out India's biggest challenge going into the T20 World CupFormer India captain Rohit Sharma has pointed out India's biggest challenge going into the T20 World Cup. Rohit has said that India need to get their combinations right in the tournament.

Abhishek Sharma and the T20 World Cup risk: Ajinkya Rahane warns India battersAjinkya Rahane feels Abhishek Sharma's high-risk style will force India's batters to take responsibility. Despite the Vizag loss, Rahane believes such intent will better prepare India for T20 World Cup pressure.

UCL: Lamine praises resilient Barcelona as team finishes top 5 in league phaseChampions League: Barcelona's Lamine Yamal praised the team's resilient show on the final day of the league phase. Barcelona overturned a 0-1 deficit and beat Copenhagen 4-1 at Camp Nou.

Kuldeep Yadav Lite: Meet Murali, teenage spinner shaped by YouTube and ambitionIndia vs New Zealand: In the heart of Vizag, a 19-year-old from Srikakulam is turning heads. Meet Ronanki Murali, the 'Kuldeep Yadav Lite' who traded a pacer's run-up for a spinner's guile, using YouTube to mirror his idol and test visiting batters in the city.

Sophie Molineux announced Alyssa Healy's heir as Australia's all-format captainSophie Molineux has been named Alyssa Healy's successor as Australia's all-format captain. The left-arm spinner will begin her leadership stint in the T20Is against India ahead of the World Cup.

Tyson Fury un-retires again: Gypsy King back for Netflix clash vs MakhmudovTyson Fury has come out of retirement once again to return to the ring in April. The former heavyweight champion will face Arslanbek Makhmudov in a Netflix-broadcast bout in the UK.

Shivam Dube not just a finisher anymore: Gavaskar hails India's T20 World Cup weaponSunil Gavaskar believes Shivam Dube has evolved into a complete T20I weapon for India. Despite the Vizag loss, the former captain feels Dube's growth with bat and ball is a major boost.

Real Madrid, PSG forced into UEFA Champions League playoff: Full knockouts listReal Madrid and PSG face an unexpected detour after slipping into the Champions League playoff round. A final night, sparked by Mourinho's Benfica drama, reshaped Europe's knockout picture.

Shivam Utlility Vehicle: How a mindset shift unlocked Dube's all-round beast modeShivam Dube is slowly morphing himself into one of India's most dependable players in the T20I setup. With a mindset shift, defined role and improved bowling, Dube is showing his true all-round value ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

PAK vs AUS: Full schedule, squads, livestreaming details and all you need to knowPAK vs AUS: Pakistan and Australia begin a three-match T20I series in Lahore from January 29, serving as key preparation for the T20 World Cup 2026, with several senior players missing from both squads.

Pakistan book Colombo flight tickets after T20 World Cup boycott antics: ReportT20 World Cup 2026: The Pakistan cricket team have been advised to stay prepared for the T20 World Cup after reportedly being advised not to boycott the tournament.

Playing India at home, no better test for New Zealand ahead of T20 World Cup 2026New Zealand captain, Mitchell Santner, believes that playing India on their home turf gives them the best form of preparation going into the T20 World Cup 2026.

Shivam Dube's sixer-fest not enough as India's T20I freight train halts in VizagIndia vs New Zealand, 4th T20I: Shivam Dube's 15-ball fifty — a six-hitting freak show — was the lone bright spot for India on Tuesday in Visakhapatnam. Their impressive run of muscle-flexing performances came to an end as New Zealand successfully defended 215 to clinch a morale-boosting victory in the five-match series.

Shivam Dube hits 3rd fastest T20I fifty by an Indian, gets dismissed in cruel twistShivam Dube blazes to India's third-fastest T20I fifty against New Zealand in Vizag, scoring 65 off 23 in a thrilling chase. However, he was dismissed in the end in a cruel twist in Vizag.

Australian Open 2026 women's singles semi-final: When and where to watchAustralian Open 2026: The women's singles semifinals at Melbourne Park feature a blockbuster final four, with Aryna Sabalenka, Elina Svitolina, Elena Rybakina, and Jessica Pegula all arriving in strong form at Melbourne Park.

IND vs NZ: Sanju Samson's Vizag T20I ends in another missed opportunitySanju Samson's poor run of form continues as he was dismissed for 24 off 16 balls during the Vizag T20I. Samson made a good start and failed to push on and get a big score.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
